This program is not available to international students wishing to study in Australia on a student visa.
Applications for this program will open in August 2025, to commence study in 2026.
To be eligible, an applicant must have achieved the following minimum entry requirements and demonstrate they fulfil any prerequisite and essential criteria for admission. In cases where there are more eligible applicants than available places, admission will be competitive with ranks based on the entry criteria.
This degree requires a Grade Point Average (GPA) equivalent to an Adelaide University 5.0 on a 7-point scale for entry.
Applicants are asked to provide:
Shortlisted applicants will be required to participate in online interviews.
Essential requirements:
In addition, international students who speak English as an additional language must have obtained one of the following standards within the last two years prior to admission. Possession of one or more of these qualifications, in addition to the academic entry requirements, does not, in itself, guarantee a place at Adelaide University. Applications are considered on an individual basis and selection is competitive. Where previous study/work experience was conducted in English, the application must be accompanied by certified documentation from the educational institution/employer certifying that the language of instruction/employment was English.

Study a world-class MBA qualification.
Secure national defence partnerships. Develop strategies for space exploration. Deepen our bi- and multilateral global relationships through advocacy and sustainability.
Change the face of defence and space industries, harnessing rapid technological advancements. Develop the skills and knowledge to meet the needs of these growing sectors.
Embark on a transformative journey across three of the world’s leading nations in defence and space.
Immerse yourself in a global experience that spans three powerhouse nations. Learn from renowned international speakers and real-world case studies. You’ll join a cohort of peers from “Five Eyes” and allied nations, preparing for global leadership opportunities.
The defence and space industries are growing rapidly. Countless projects are being undertaken in Australia and around the world. Long-term partnerships between Australia, the US, and the UK have strengthened cooperative relationships. Their collaboration leads to further understanding on global supply chains, geopolitical dynamics and localised defence requirements.
The Global Executive MBA (Defence and Space) is delivered in partnership with the University of Exeter (UK) and Carnegie Mellon University (US). Our program provides invaluable networking opportunities with industry experts and peers.
Study curriculum across three continents, informed by input from world-leading defence policy institutes and thinktanks. Get ready to join the global debate stage on defence and space topics.
Adelaide University’s Global Executive MBA (Defence and Space) will build on your expertise in strategic thinking, ethical conduct, responsible leadership and evidence-based decision making.
Our degree has a strong practical focus that is taught from a global perspective. Explore the latest in defence and space management research. Advance your skills in executive leadership and senior management decision-making.
The program consists of a total of eleven core courses. Industry-specific topics include cybersecurity, space systems and complex defence project management. You’ll also study core business topics in leadership, strategy and finance.
Delivered across three countries (Australia, the UK and the US), you’ll study an intensive two weeks in each location*. Online courses will also be delivered throughout your studies.
Our curriculum has a strong practical focus, specifically designed for those already employed in the defence and space sectors.
Your capstone project will give you the opportunity to synthesis your knowledge in an applied setting. Engage in real-world experiences with international colleagues, contributing to your personal and professional development.
Undertake case studies in key areas like strategy, global leadership, procurement and geopolitics in defence and space settings. Apply your learning to relevant industry settings and graduate ready to take what you’ve learned into your career.
*Please note, you’ll need to obtain any required travel visas for Australia, the UK and the US. Wait times can vary, so it’s important to get started early. For further information, visit Australian Department of Home Affairs, U.S. Department of Home Affairs and Gov.UK.
This degree is part of a stackable set of qualifications, meaning your study choices are flexible. If your goals shift, you can exit after six months of study with a standalone Graduate Certificate or after one year with a Graduate Diploma qualification.
You can also begin your studies with a shorter qualification like the six-month Graduate Certificate and continue on to complete the Graduate Diploma (one year) or full master’s degree.
Complete 72 units comprising:
Complete 72 units for ALL of the following:
Notes
1. BUSI5060 and BUSI5013 will be delivered as the first residential in Adelaide, Australia.
2. BUSI5059 and BUSI5055 will be delivered as the second residential in London and Exeter, United Kingdom.
3. BUSI5058 and BUSI6009 will be delivered as the third residential in Washington D.C. and Pittsburgh, United States of America.
4. BUSI5061, INFO5005, BUSI5057, BUSI5016, and BUSI5056 will be delivered online only.
This program can only be studied full-time, in the order specified in the program schedule above, with completion of courses in Adelaide, South Australia first.

This program can only be studied full-time, in the order specified in the program schedule above, with completion of courses in Adelaide, South Australia first.
Our MBA will future-proof your career in defence and space. You’ll graduate with the knowledge to set yourself apart in the competitive job market. Become a global entrepreneur and leader, confident to handle challenges in global defence and space contexts.
You’ll also engage with a diverse global network of experienced industry professionals throughout your degree. Be poised to harness your connections and work collaboratively to shape the future of your industry.
Graduates of this program can excel as leaders in industry across senior management and leadership roles. Your comprehensive knowledge of defence and space sector developments might be applied to roles in cybersecurity, space systems, space operations, geopolitics, defence procurement and more.
Australia, the United Kingdom and the United States have recently reached a significant milestone in our AUKUS agreement. The UK and US will now cooperate with Australia in safely building, operating and maintaining a conventionally-armed, nuclear-powered submarine capability. Future SSN-AUKUS submarines will be built at Osborne in South Australia (Australian Government Defence, 2024).
According to the Australian Institute of International Affairs (2024), ‘Australia’s space industry has A$2 billion in planned capital investments [with a commitment] to invest A$7 billion over the next decade in the Defence Department’s space capabilities.'
Graduate from your Adelaide University degree with the global leadership skills needed to contribute to these expanding industries.
Before you begin, find the degree you wish to study and check you meet the academic entry requirements and English language requirements.

In cases where there are more eligible applicants than available places, admission will be competitive with ranks based on the entry criteria.
A completed bachelor (AQF level 7) or bachelor honours (AQF level 8) degree or equivalent from a recognised higher education institution PLUS a minimum of three years full time (or equivalent) management experience.Applicants who do not have an undergraduate qualification may be considered for entry into the Graduate Certificate program if they have a minimum of 7 years full-time (or equivalent) management experience.
This degree requires a Grade Point Average (GPA) equivalent to an Adelaide University 5.0 on a 7-point scale for entry.
 Applicants are asked to provide:

Why  Global Executive Master of Business Administration (Defence and Space)?
Study a world-class MBA qualification.  
Secure national defence partnerships. Develop strategies for space exploration. Deepen our bi- and multilateral global relationships through advocacy and sustainability.  
Change the face of defence and space industries, harnessing rapid technological advancements. Develop the skills and knowledge to meet the needs of these growing sectors. 
Embark on a transformative journey across three of the world’s leading nations in defence and space.  













Overview
Immerse yourself in a global experience that spans three powerhouse nations. Learn from renowned international speakers and real-world case studies. You’ll join a cohort of peers from “Five Eyes” and allied nations, preparing for global leadership opportunities. 
The defence and space industries are growing rapidly. Countless projects are being undertaken in Australia and around the world. Long-term partnerships between Australia, the US, and the UK have strengthened cooperative relationships. Their collaboration leads to further understanding on global supply chains, geopolitical dynamics and localised defence requirements.  
The Global Executive MBA (Defence and Space) is delivered in partnership with the University of Exeter (UK) and Carnegie Mellon University (US). Our program provides invaluable networking opportunities with industry experts and peers. 
Study curriculum across three continents, informed by input from world-leading defence policy institutes and thinktanks. Get ready to join the global debate stage on defence and space topics. 




Key features
Learn from internationally recognised academics and industry leaders in defence and space. Study a curriculum tailored to the defence and space industries. Take your studies abroad with in-country residentials in Australia, the UK and the US. Build your leadership skills by drawing on a unique global model. Gain a solid understanding of sector developments, challenges and solutions. Engage with a diverse global network of experienced professionals. Study online and attend immersive residential experiences in Adelaide, Washington DC and Exeter. 







What you'll learn
Adelaide University’s Global Executive MBA (Defence and Space) will build on your expertise in strategic thinking, ethical conduct, responsible leadership and evidence-based decision making.
Our degree has a strong practical focus that is taught from a global perspective. Explore the latest in defence and space management research. Advance your skills in executive leadership and senior management decision-making.  
The program consists of a total of eleven core courses. Industry-specific topics include cybersecurity, space systems and complex defence project management. You’ll also study core business topics in leadership, strategy and finance. 
Delivered across three countries (Australia, the UK and the US), you’ll study an intensive two weeks in each location*. Online courses will also be delivered throughout your studies.
Our curriculum has a strong practical focus, specifically designed for those already employed in the defence and space sectors.  
Your capstone project will give you the opportunity to synthesis your knowledge in an applied setting. Engage in real-world experiences with international colleagues, contributing to your personal and professional development. 
Undertake case studies in key areas like strategy, global leadership, procurement and geopolitics in defence and space settings. Apply your learning to relevant industry settings and graduate ready to take what you’ve learned into your career.
*Please note, you’ll need to obtain any required travel visas for Australia, the UK and the US. Wait times can vary, so it’s important to get started early. For further information, visit Australian Department of Home Affairs, U.S. Department of Home Affairs and Gov.UK.
























              More about what you’ll learn
            






              Less about what you’ll learn
             






















Design a study path that works for you
This degree is part of a stackable set of qualifications, meaning your study choices are flexible. If your goals shift, you can exit after six months of study with a standalone Graduate Certificate or after one year with a Graduate Diploma qualification. 
You can also begin your studies with a shorter qualification like the six-month Graduate Certificate and continue on to complete the Graduate Diploma (one year) or full master’s degree.

Career outcomes
Our MBA will future-proof your career in defence and space. You’ll graduate with the knowledge to set yourself apart in the competitive job market. Become a global entrepreneur and leader, confident to handle challenges in global defence and space contexts.  
You’ll also engage with a diverse global network of experienced industry professionals throughout your degree. Be poised to harness your connections and work collaboratively to shape the future of your industry.
Graduates of this program can excel as leaders in industry across senior management and leadership roles. Your comprehensive knowledge of defence and space sector developments might be applied to roles in cybersecurity, space systems, space operations, geopolitics, defence procurement and more. 
Industry trends 
Australia, the United Kingdom and the United States have recently reached a significant milestone in our AUKUS agreement. The UK and US will now cooperate with Australia in safely building, operating and maintaining a conventionally-armed, nuclear-powered submarine capability. Future SSN-AUKUS submarines will be built at Osborne in South Australia (Australian Government Defence, 2024).  
According to the Australian Institute of International Affairs (2024), ‘Australia’s space industry has A$2 billion in planned capital investments [with a commitment] to invest A$7 billion over the next decade in the Defence Department’s space capabilities.'
Graduate from your Adelaide University degree with the global leadership skills needed to contribute to these expanding industries.

Applications for this program will open in August 2025, to commence study in 2026.
To be eligible, an applicant must have achieved the following minimum entry requirements and demonstrate they fulfil any prerequisite and essential criteria for admission. In cases where there are more eligible applicants than available places, admission will be competitive with ranks based on the entry criteria.
A completed bachelor (AQF level 7) or bachelor honours (AQF level 8) degree or equivalent from a recognised higher education institution PLUS a minimum of three years full time (or equivalent) management experience.Applicants who do not have an undergraduate qualification may be considered for entry into the Graduate Certificate program if they have a minimum of 7 years full-time (or equivalent) management experience.
This degree requires a Grade Point Average (GPA) equivalent to an Adelaide University 5.0 on a 7-point scale for entry.
 Applicants are asked to provide:
A Curriculum Vitae outlining their work and management experience; ANDA statement outlining their reasons for applying for the Global Executive MBA (Defence and Space) program and how it fits with their career goals within the defence and space sectors.
Shortlisted applicants will be required to participate in online interviews.
 Essential requirements:
Applicants must be citizens of any of the "Five Eyes" (Australia, Canada, New Zealand, United Kingdom, United States) or allied nations.Where previous study/work experience was conducted in English, the application must be accompanied by certified documentation from the educational institution/employer certifying that the language of instruction/employment was English.
English language entry requirements
In addition, international students who speak English as an additional language must have obtained one of the following standards within the last two years prior to admission. Possession of one or more of these qualifications, in addition to the academic entry requirements, does not, in itself, guarantee a place at Adelaide University. Applications are considered on an individual basis and selection is competitive. Where previous study/work experience was conducted in English, the application must be accompanied by certified documentation from the educational institution/employer certifying that the language of instruction/employment was English.

IELTS Overall 7.5
IELTS Reading 7
IELTS Listening 7
IELTS Speaking 7
IELTS Writing 7

Why  Global Executive Master of Business Administration (Defence and Space)?
Study a world-class MBA qualification.  
Secure national defence partnerships. Develop strategies for space exploration. Deepen our bi- and multilateral global relationships through advocacy and sustainability.  
Change the face of defence and space industries, harnessing rapid technological advancements. Develop the skills and knowledge to meet the needs of these growing sectors. 
Embark on a transformative journey across three of the world’s leading nations in defence and space.  













Overview
Immerse yourself in a global experience that spans three powerhouse nations. Learn from renowned international speakers and real-world case studies. You’ll join a cohort of peers from “Five Eyes” and allied nations, preparing for global leadership opportunities. 
The defence and space industries are growing rapidly. Countless projects are being undertaken in Australia and around the world. Long-term partnerships between Australia, the US, and the UK have strengthened cooperative relationships. Their collaboration leads to further understanding on global supply chains, geopolitical dynamics and localised defence requirements.  
The Global Executive MBA (Defence and Space) is delivered in partnership with the University of Exeter (UK) and Carnegie Mellon University (US). Our program provides invaluable networking opportunities with industry experts and peers. 
Study curriculum across three continents, informed by input from world-leading defence policy institutes and thinktanks. Get ready to join the global debate stage on defence and space topics. 




Key features
Learn from internationally recognised academics and industry leaders in defence and space. Study a curriculum tailored to the defence and space industries. Take your studies abroad with in-country residentials in Australia, the UK and the US. Build your leadership skills by drawing on a unique global model. Gain a solid understanding of sector developments, challenges and solutions. Engage with a diverse global network of experienced professionals. Study online and attend immersive residential experiences in Adelaide, Washington DC and Exeter. 







What you'll learn
Adelaide University’s Global Executive MBA (Defence and Space) will build on your expertise in strategic thinking, ethical conduct, responsible leadership and evidence-based decision making.
Our degree has a strong practical focus that is taught from a global perspective. Explore the latest in defence and space management research. Advance your skills in executive leadership and senior management decision-making.  
The program consists of a total of eleven core courses. Industry-specific topics include cybersecurity, space systems and complex defence project management. You’ll also study core business topics in leadership, strategy and finance. 
Delivered across three countries (Australia, the UK and the US), you’ll study an intensive two weeks in each location*. Online courses will also be delivered throughout your studies.
Our curriculum has a strong practical focus, specifically designed for those already employed in the defence and space sectors.  
Your capstone project will give you the opportunity to synthesis your knowledge in an applied setting. Engage in real-world experiences with international colleagues, contributing to your personal and professional development. 
Undertake case studies in key areas like strategy, global leadership, procurement and geopolitics in defence and space settings. Apply your learning to relevant industry settings and graduate ready to take what you’ve learned into your career.
*Please note, you’ll need to obtain any required travel visas for Australia, the UK and the US. Wait times can vary, so it’s important to get started early. For further information, visit Australian Department of Home Affairs, U.S. Department of Home Affairs and Gov.UK.

Design a study path that works for you
This degree is part of a stackable set of qualifications, meaning your study choices are flexible. If your goals shift, you can exit after six months of study with a standalone Graduate Certificate or after one year with a Graduate Diploma qualification. 
You can also begin your studies with a shorter qualification like the six-month Graduate Certificate and continue on to complete the Graduate Diploma (one year) or full master’s degree.

Notes
1. BUSI5060 and BUSI5013 will be delivered as the first residential in Adelaide, Australia.
2. BUSI5059 and BUSI5055 will be delivered as the second residential in London and Exeter, United Kingdom.
3. BUSI5058 and BUSI6009 will be delivered as the third residential in Washington D.C. and Pittsburgh, United States of America.
4. BUSI5061, INFO5005, BUSI5057, BUSI5016, and BUSI5056 will be delivered online only.
This program can only be studied full-time, in the order specified in the program schedule above, with completion of courses in Adelaide, South Australia first.

Career outcomes
Our MBA will future-proof your career in defence and space. You’ll graduate with the knowledge to set yourself apart in the competitive job market. Become a global entrepreneur and leader, confident to handle challenges in global defence and space contexts.  
You’ll also engage with a diverse global network of experienced industry professionals throughout your degree. Be poised to harness your connections and work collaboratively to shape the future of your industry.
Graduates of this program can excel as leaders in industry across senior management and leadership roles. Your comprehensive knowledge of defence and space sector developments might be applied to roles in cybersecurity, space systems, space operations, geopolitics, defence procurement and more. 
Industry trends 
Australia, the United Kingdom and the United States have recently reached a significant milestone in our AUKUS agreement. The UK and US will now cooperate with Australia in safely building, operating and maintaining a conventionally-armed, nuclear-powered submarine capability. Future SSN-AUKUS submarines will be built at Osborne in South Australia (Australian Government Defence, 2024).  
According to the Australian Institute of International Affairs (2024), ‘Australia’s space industry has A$2 billion in planned capital investments [with a commitment] to invest A$7 billion over the next decade in the Defence Department’s space capabilities.'
Graduate from your Adelaide University degree with the global leadership skills needed to contribute to these expanding industries.

Embark on a transformative journey across three of the world’s leading nations in defence and space.  













Overview
Immerse yourself in a global experience that spans three powerhouse nations. Learn from renowned international speakers and real-world case studies. You’ll join a cohort of peers from “Five Eyes” and allied nations, preparing for global leadership opportunities. 
The defence and space industries are growing rapidly. Countless projects are being undertaken in Australia and around the world. Long-term partnerships between Australia, the US, and the UK have strengthened cooperative relationships. Their collaboration leads to further understanding on global supply chains, geopolitical dynamics and localised defence requirements.  
The Global Executive MBA (Defence and Space) is delivered in partnership with the University of Exeter (UK) and Carnegie Mellon University (US). Our program provides invaluable networking opportunities with industry experts and peers. 
Study curriculum across three continents, informed by input from world-leading defence policy institutes and thinktanks. Get ready to join the global debate stage on defence and space topics.
Key features
Learn from internationally recognised academics and industry leaders in defence and space. Study a curriculum tailored to the defence and space industries. Take your studies abroad with in-country residentials in Australia, the UK and the US. Build your leadership skills by drawing on a unique global model. Gain a solid understanding of sector developments, challenges and solutions. Engage with a diverse global network of experienced professionals. Study online and attend immersive residential experiences in Adelaide, Washington DC and Exeter.
What you'll learn
Adelaide University’s Global Executive MBA (Defence and Space) will build on your expertise in strategic thinking, ethical conduct, responsible leadership and evidence-based decision making.
Our degree has a strong practical focus that is taught from a global perspective. Explore the latest in defence and space management research. Advance your skills in executive leadership and senior management decision-making.  
The program consists of a total of eleven core courses. Industry-specific topics include cybersecurity, space systems and complex defence project management. You’ll also study core business topics in leadership, strategy and finance. 
Delivered across three countries (Australia, the UK and the US), you’ll study an intensive two weeks in each location*. Online courses will also be delivered throughout your studies.
Our curriculum has a strong practical focus, specifically designed for those already employed in the defence and space sectors.  
Your capstone project will give you the opportunity to synthesis your knowledge in an applied setting. Engage in real-world experiences with international colleagues, contributing to your personal and professional development. 
Undertake case studies in key areas like strategy, global leadership, procurement and geopolitics in defence and space settings. Apply your learning to relevant industry settings and graduate ready to take what you’ve learned into your career.
*Please note, you’ll need to obtain any required travel visas for Australia, the UK and the US. Wait times can vary, so it’s important to get started early. For further information, visit Australian Department of Home Affairs, U.S. Department of Home Affairs and Gov.UK.

Career outcomes
Our MBA will future-proof your career in defence and space. You’ll graduate with the knowledge to set yourself apart in the competitive job market. Become a global entrepreneur and leader, confident to handle challenges in global defence and space contexts.  
You’ll also engage with a diverse global network of experienced industry professionals throughout your degree. Be poised to harness your connections and work collaboratively to shape the future of your industry.
Graduates of this program can excel as leaders in industry across senior management and leadership roles. Your comprehensive knowledge of defence and space sector developments might be applied to roles in cybersecurity, space systems, space operations, geopolitics, defence procurement and more. 
Industry trends 
Australia, the United Kingdom and the United States have recently reached a significant milestone in our AUKUS agreement. The UK and US will now cooperate with Australia in safely building, operating and maintaining a conventionally-armed, nuclear-powered submarine capability. Future SSN-AUKUS submarines will be built at Osborne in South Australia (Australian Government Defence, 2024).  
According to the Australian Institute of International Affairs (2024), ‘Australia’s space industry has A$2 billion in planned capital investments [with a commitment] to invest A$7 billion over the next decade in the Defence Department’s space capabilities.'
Graduate from your Adelaide University degree with the global leadership skills needed to contribute to these expanding industries.

Entry requirements




Admission criteria
This program is not available to international students wishing to study in Australia on a student visa.
Applications for this program will open in August 2025, to commence study in 2026.
To be eligible, an applicant must have achieved the following minimum entry requirements and demonstrate they fulfil any prerequisite and essential criteria for admission. In cases where there are more eligible applicants than available places, admission will be competitive with ranks based on the entry criteria.
A completed bachelor (AQF level 7) or bachelor honours (AQF level 8) degree or equivalent from a recognised higher education institution PLUS a minimum of three years full time (or equivalent) management experience.Applicants who do not have an undergraduate qualification may be considered for entry into the Graduate Certificate program if they have a minimum of 7 years full-time (or equivalent) management experience.
This degree requires a Grade Point Average (GPA) equivalent to an Adelaide University 5.0 on a 7-point scale for entry.
 Applicants are asked to provide:
A Curriculum Vitae outlining their work and management experience; ANDA statement outlining their reasons for applying for the Global Executive MBA (Defence and Space) program and how it fits with their career goals within the defence and space sectors.
Shortlisted applicants will be required to participate in online interviews.
 Essential requirements:
Applicants must be citizens of any of the "Five Eyes" (Australia, Canada, New Zealand, United Kingdom, United States) or allied nations.Where previous study/work experience was conducted in English, the application must be accompanied by certified documentation from the educational institution/employer certifying that the language of instruction/employment was English.
English language entry requirements
In addition, international students who speak English as an additional language must have obtained one of the following standards within the last two years prior to admission. Possession of one or more of these qualifications, in addition to the academic entry requirements, does not, in itself, guarantee a place at Adelaide University. Applications are considered on an individual basis and selection is competitive. Where previous study/work experience was conducted in English, the application must be accompanied by certified documentation from the educational institution/employer certifying that the language of instruction/employment was English.

IELTS Reading 7

IELTS Speaking 7

Career outcomes
Our MBA will future-proof your career in defence and space. You’ll graduate with the knowledge to set yourself apart in the competitive job market. Become a global entrepreneur and leader, confident to handle challenges in global defence and space contexts.  
You’ll also engage with a diverse global network of experienced industry professionals throughout your degree. Be poised to harness your connections and work collaboratively to shape the future of your industry.
Graduates of this program can excel as leaders in industry across senior management and leadership roles. Your comprehensive knowledge of defence and space sector developments might be applied to roles in cybersecurity, space systems, space operations, geopolitics, defence procurement and more. 
Industry trends 
Australia, the United Kingdom and the United States have recently reached a significant milestone in our AUKUS agreement. The UK and US will now cooperate with Australia in safely building, operating and maintaining a conventionally-armed, nuclear-powered submarine capability. Future SSN-AUKUS submarines will be built at Osborne in South Australia (Australian Government Defence, 2024).  
According to the Australian Institute of International Affairs (2024), ‘Australia’s space industry has A$2 billion in planned capital investments [with a commitment] to invest A$7 billion over the next decade in the Defence Department’s space capabilities.'
Graduate from your Adelaide University degree with the global leadership skills needed to contribute to these expanding industries.

Entry requirements




Admission criteria
This program is not available to international students wishing to study in Australia on a student visa.
Applications for this program will open in August 2025, to commence study in 2026.
To be eligible, an applicant must have achieved the following minimum entry requirements and demonstrate they fulfil any prerequisite and essential criteria for admission. In cases where there are more eligible applicants than available places, admission will be competitive with ranks based on the entry criteria.
A completed bachelor (AQF level 7) or bachelor honours (AQF level 8) degree or equivalent from a recognised higher education institution PLUS a minimum of three years full time (or equivalent) management experience.Applicants who do not have an undergraduate qualification may be considered for entry into the Graduate Certificate program if they have a minimum of 7 years full-time (or equivalent) management experience.
This degree requires a Grade Point Average (GPA) equivalent to an Adelaide University 5.0 on a 7-point scale for entry.
 Applicants are asked to provide:
A Curriculum Vitae outlining their work and management experience; ANDA statement outlining their reasons for applying for the Global Executive MBA (Defence and Space) program and how it fits with their career goals within the defence and space sectors.
Shortlisted applicants will be required to participate in online interviews.
 Essential requirements:
Applicants must be citizens of any of the "Five Eyes" (Australia, Canada, New Zealand, United Kingdom, United States) or allied nations.Where previous study/work experience was conducted in English, the application must be accompanied by certified documentation from the educational institution/employer certifying that the language of instruction/employment was English.
English language entry requirements
In addition, international students who speak English as an additional language must have obtained one of the following standards within the last two years prior to admission. Possession of one or more of these qualifications, in addition to the academic entry requirements, does not, in itself, guarantee a place at Adelaide University. Applications are considered on an individual basis and selection is competitive. Where previous study/work experience was conducted in English, the application must be accompanied by certified documentation from the educational institution/employer certifying that the language of instruction/employment was English.

Why  Global Executive Master of Business Administration (Defence and Space)?
Study a world-class MBA qualification.  
Secure national defence partnerships. Develop strategies for space exploration. Deepen our bi- and multilateral global relationships through advocacy and sustainability.  
Change the face of defence and space industries, harnessing rapid technological advancements. Develop the skills and knowledge to meet the needs of these growing sectors. 
Embark on a transformative journey across three of the world’s leading nations in defence and space.  













Overview
Immerse yourself in a global experience that spans three powerhouse nations. Learn from renowned international speakers and real-world case studies. You’ll join a cohort of peers from “Five Eyes” and allied nations, preparing for global leadership opportunities. 
The defence and space industries are growing rapidly. Countless projects are being undertaken in Australia and around the world. Long-term partnerships between Australia, the US, and the UK have strengthened cooperative relationships. Their collaboration leads to further understanding on global supply chains, geopolitical dynamics and localised defence requirements.  
The Global Executive MBA (Defence and Space) is delivered in partnership with the University of Exeter (UK) and Carnegie Mellon University (US). Our program provides invaluable networking opportunities with industry experts and peers. 
Study curriculum across three continents, informed by input from world-leading defence policy institutes and thinktanks. Get ready to join the global debate stage on defence and space topics. 




Key features
Learn from internationally recognised academics and industry leaders in defence and space. Study a curriculum tailored to the defence and space industries. Take your studies abroad with in-country residentials in Australia, the UK and the US. Build your leadership skills by drawing on a unique global model. Gain a solid understanding of sector developments, challenges and solutions. Engage with a diverse global network of experienced professionals. Study online and attend immersive residential experiences in Adelaide, Washington DC and Exeter. 







What you'll learn
Adelaide University’s Global Executive MBA (Defence and Space) will build on your expertise in strategic thinking, ethical conduct, responsible leadership and evidence-based decision making.
Our degree has a strong practical focus that is taught from a global perspective. Explore the latest in defence and space management research. Advance your skills in executive leadership and senior management decision-making.  
The program consists of a total of eleven core courses. Industry-specific topics include cybersecurity, space systems and complex defence project management. You’ll also study core business topics in leadership, strategy and finance. 
Delivered across three countries (Australia, the UK and the US), you’ll study an intensive two weeks in each location*. Online courses will also be delivered throughout your studies.
Our curriculum has a strong practical focus, specifically designed for those already employed in the defence and space sectors.  
Your capstone project will give you the opportunity to synthesis your knowledge in an applied setting. Engage in real-world experiences with international colleagues, contributing to your personal and professional development. 
Undertake case studies in key areas like strategy, global leadership, procurement and geopolitics in defence and space settings. Apply your learning to relevant industry settings and graduate ready to take what you’ve learned into your career.
*Please note, you’ll need to obtain any required travel visas for Australia, the UK and the US. Wait times can vary, so it’s important to get started early. For further information, visit Australian Department of Home Affairs, U.S. Department of Home Affairs and Gov.UK.

This degree is part of a stackable set of qualifications, meaning your study choices are flexible. If your goals shift, you can exit after six months of study with a standalone Graduate Certificate or after one year with a Graduate Diploma qualification. 
You can also begin your studies with a shorter qualification like the six-month Graduate Certificate and continue on to complete the Graduate Diploma (one year) or full master’s degree.

Career outcomes
Our MBA will future-proof your career in defence and space. You’ll graduate with the knowledge to set yourself apart in the competitive job market. Become a global entrepreneur and leader, confident to handle challenges in global defence and space contexts.  
You’ll also engage with a diverse global network of experienced industry professionals throughout your degree. Be poised to harness your connections and work collaboratively to shape the future of your industry.
Graduates of this program can excel as leaders in industry across senior management and leadership roles. Your comprehensive knowledge of defence and space sector developments might be applied to roles in cybersecurity, space systems, space operations, geopolitics, defence procurement and more. 
Industry trends 
Australia, the United Kingdom and the United States have recently reached a significant milestone in our AUKUS agreement. The UK and US will now cooperate with Australia in safely building, operating and maintaining a conventionally-armed, nuclear-powered submarine capability. Future SSN-AUKUS submarines will be built at Osborne in South Australia (Australian Government Defence, 2024).  
According to the Australian Institute of International Affairs (2024), ‘Australia’s space industry has A$2 billion in planned capital investments [with a commitment] to invest A$7 billion over the next decade in the Defence Department’s space capabilities.'
Graduate from your Adelaide University degree with the global leadership skills needed to contribute to these expanding industries.

Entry requirements




Admission criteria
This program is not available to international students wishing to study in Australia on a student visa.
Applications for this program will open in August 2025, to commence study in 2026.
To be eligible, an applicant must have achieved the following minimum entry requirements and demonstrate they fulfil any prerequisite and essential criteria for admission. In cases where there are more eligible applicants than available places, admission will be competitive with ranks based on the entry criteria.
A completed bachelor (AQF level 7) or bachelor honours (AQF level 8) degree or equivalent from a recognised higher education institution PLUS a minimum of three years full time (or equivalent) management experience.Applicants who do not have an undergraduate qualification may be considered for entry into the Graduate Certificate program if they have a minimum of 7 years full-time (or equivalent) management experience.
This degree requires a Grade Point Average (GPA) equivalent to an Adelaide University 5.0 on a 7-point scale for entry.
 Applicants are asked to provide:
A Curriculum Vitae outlining their work and management experience; ANDA statement outlining their reasons for applying for the Global Executive MBA (Defence and Space) program and how it fits with their career goals within the defence and space sectors.
Shortlisted applicants will be required to participate in online interviews.
 Essential requirements:
Applicants must be citizens of any of the "Five Eyes" (Australia, Canada, New Zealand, United Kingdom, United States) or allied nations.Where previous study/work experience was conducted in English, the application must be accompanied by certified documentation from the educational institution/employer certifying that the language of instruction/employment was English.
English language entry requirements
In addition, international students who speak English as an additional language must have obtained one of the following standards within the last two years prior to admission. Possession of one or more of these qualifications, in addition to the academic entry requirements, does not, in itself, guarantee a place at Adelaide University. Applications are considered on an individual basis and selection is competitive. Where previous study/work experience was conducted in English, the application must be accompanied by certified documentation from the educational institution/employer certifying that the language of instruction/employment was English.

Why  Global Executive Master of Business Administration (Defence and Space)?
Study a world-class MBA qualification.  
Secure national defence partnerships. Develop strategies for space exploration. Deepen our bi- and multilateral global relationships through advocacy and sustainability.  
Change the face of defence and space industries, harnessing rapid technological advancements. Develop the skills and knowledge to meet the needs of these growing sectors. 
Embark on a transformative journey across three of the world’s leading nations in defence and space.  













Overview
Immerse yourself in a global experience that spans three powerhouse nations. Learn from renowned international speakers and real-world case studies. You’ll join a cohort of peers from “Five Eyes” and allied nations, preparing for global leadership opportunities. 
The defence and space industries are growing rapidly. Countless projects are being undertaken in Australia and around the world. Long-term partnerships between Australia, the US, and the UK have strengthened cooperative relationships. Their collaboration leads to further understanding on global supply chains, geopolitical dynamics and localised defence requirements.  
The Global Executive MBA (Defence and Space) is delivered in partnership with the University of Exeter (UK) and Carnegie Mellon University (US). Our program provides invaluable networking opportunities with industry experts and peers. 
Study curriculum across three continents, informed by input from world-leading defence policy institutes and thinktanks. Get ready to join the global debate stage on defence and space topics. 




Key features
Learn from internationally recognised academics and industry leaders in defence and space. Study a curriculum tailored to the defence and space industries. Take your studies abroad with in-country residentials in Australia, the UK and the US. Build your leadership skills by drawing on a unique global model. Gain a solid understanding of sector developments, challenges and solutions. Engage with a diverse global network of experienced professionals. Study online and attend immersive residential experiences in Adelaide, Washington DC and Exeter. 







What you'll learn
Adelaide University’s Global Executive MBA (Defence and Space) will build on your expertise in strategic thinking, ethical conduct, responsible leadership and evidence-based decision making.
Our degree has a strong practical focus that is taught from a global perspective. Explore the latest in defence and space management research. Advance your skills in executive leadership and senior management decision-making.  
The program consists of a total of eleven core courses. Industry-specific topics include cybersecurity, space systems and complex defence project management. You’ll also study core business topics in leadership, strategy and finance. 
Delivered across three countries (Australia, the UK and the US), you’ll study an intensive two weeks in each location*. Online courses will also be delivered throughout your studies.
Our curriculum has a strong practical focus, specifically designed for those already employed in the defence and space sectors.  
Your capstone project will give you the opportunity to synthesis your knowledge in an applied setting. Engage in real-world experiences with international colleagues, contributing to your personal and professional development. 
Undertake case studies in key areas like strategy, global leadership, procurement and geopolitics in defence and space settings. Apply your learning to relevant industry settings and graduate ready to take what you’ve learned into your career.
*Please note, you’ll need to obtain any required travel visas for Australia, the UK and the US. Wait times can vary, so it’s important to get started early. For further information, visit Australian Department of Home Affairs, U.S. Department of Home Affairs and Gov.UK.
























              More about what you’ll learn
            






              Less about what you’ll learn
             






















Design a study path that works for you
This degree is part of a stackable set of qualifications, meaning your study choices are flexible. If your goals shift, you can exit after six months of study with a standalone Graduate Certificate or after one year with a Graduate Diploma qualification. 
You can also begin your studies with a shorter qualification like the six-month Graduate Certificate and continue on to complete the Graduate Diploma (one year) or full master’s degree.

Adelaide University’s Global Executive MBA (Defence and Space) will build on your expertise in strategic thinking, ethical conduct, responsible leadership and evidence-based decision making.
Our degree has a strong practical focus that is taught from a global perspective. Explore the latest in defence and space management research. Advance your skills in executive leadership and senior management decision-making.  
The program consists of a total of eleven core courses. Industry-specific topics include cybersecurity, space systems and complex defence project management. You’ll also study core business topics in leadership, strategy and finance. 
Delivered across three countries (Australia, the UK and the US), you’ll study an intensive two weeks in each location*. Online courses will also be delivered throughout your studies.
Our curriculum has a strong practical focus, specifically designed for those already employed in the defence and space sectors.  
Your capstone project will give you the opportunity to synthesis your knowledge in an applied setting. Engage in real-world experiences with international colleagues, contributing to your personal and professional development. 
Undertake case studies in key areas like strategy, global leadership, procurement and geopolitics in defence and space settings. Apply your learning to relevant industry settings and graduate ready to take what you’ve learned into your career.
*Please note, you’ll need to obtain any required travel visas for Australia, the UK and the US. Wait times can vary, so it’s important to get started early. For further information, visit Australian Department of Home Affairs, U.S. Department of Home Affairs and Gov.UK.

Design a study path that works for you
This degree is part of a stackable set of qualifications, meaning your study choices are flexible. If your goals shift, you can exit after six months of study with a standalone Graduate Certificate or after one year with a Graduate Diploma qualification. 
You can also begin your studies with a shorter qualification like the six-month Graduate Certificate and continue on to complete the Graduate Diploma (one year) or full master’s degree.

Career outcomes
Our MBA will future-proof your career in defence and space. You’ll graduate with the knowledge to set yourself apart in the competitive job market. Become a global entrepreneur and leader, confident to handle challenges in global defence and space contexts.  
You’ll also engage with a diverse global network of experienced industry professionals throughout your degree. Be poised to harness your connections and work collaboratively to shape the future of your industry.
Graduates of this program can excel as leaders in industry across senior management and leadership roles. Your comprehensive knowledge of defence and space sector developments might be applied to roles in cybersecurity, space systems, space operations, geopolitics, defence procurement and more. 
Industry trends 
Australia, the United Kingdom and the United States have recently reached a significant milestone in our AUKUS agreement. The UK and US will now cooperate with Australia in safely building, operating and maintaining a conventionally-armed, nuclear-powered submarine capability. Future SSN-AUKUS submarines will be built at Osborne in South Australia (Australian Government Defence, 2024).  
According to the Australian Institute of International Affairs (2024), ‘Australia’s space industry has A$2 billion in planned capital investments [with a commitment] to invest A$7 billion over the next decade in the Defence Department’s space capabilities.'
Graduate from your Adelaide University degree with the global leadership skills needed to contribute to these expanding industries.

Admission criteria
This program is not available to international students wishing to study in Australia on a student visa.
Applications for this program will open in August 2025, to commence study in 2026.
To be eligible, an applicant must have achieved the following minimum entry requirements and demonstrate they fulfil any prerequisite and essential criteria for admission. In cases where there are more eligible applicants than available places, admission will be competitive with ranks based on the entry criteria.
A completed bachelor (AQF level 7) or bachelor honours (AQF level 8) degree or equivalent from a recognised higher education institution PLUS a minimum of three years full time (or equivalent) management experience.Applicants who do not have an undergraduate qualification may be considered for entry into the Graduate Certificate program if they have a minimum of 7 years full-time (or equivalent) management experience.
This degree requires a Grade Point Average (GPA) equivalent to an Adelaide University 5.0 on a 7-point scale for entry.
 Applicants are asked to provide:
A Curriculum Vitae outlining their work and management experience; ANDA statement outlining their reasons for applying for the Global Executive MBA (Defence and Space) program and how it fits with their career goals within the defence and space sectors.
Shortlisted applicants will be required to participate in online interviews.
 Essential requirements:
Applicants must be citizens of any of the "Five Eyes" (Australia, Canada, New Zealand, United Kingdom, United States) or allied nations.Where previous study/work experience was conducted in English, the application must be accompanied by certified documentation from the educational institution/employer certifying that the language of instruction/employment was English.
English language entry requirements
In addition, international students who speak English as an additional language must have obtained one of the following standards within the last two years prior to admission. Possession of one or more of these qualifications, in addition to the academic entry requirements, does not, in itself, guarantee a place at Adelaide University. Applications are considered on an individual basis and selection is competitive. Where previous study/work experience was conducted in English, the application must be accompanied by certified documentation from the educational institution/employer certifying that the language of instruction/employment was English.

Why  Global Executive Master of Business Administration (Defence and Space)?
Study a world-class MBA qualification.  
Secure national defence partnerships. Develop strategies for space exploration. Deepen our bi- and multilateral global relationships through advocacy and sustainability.  
Change the face of defence and space industries, harnessing rapid technological advancements. Develop the skills and knowledge to meet the needs of these growing sectors. 
Embark on a transformative journey across three of the world’s leading nations in defence and space.  













Overview
Immerse yourself in a global experience that spans three powerhouse nations. Learn from renowned international speakers and real-world case studies. You’ll join a cohort of peers from “Five Eyes” and allied nations, preparing for global leadership opportunities. 
The defence and space industries are growing rapidly. Countless projects are being undertaken in Australia and around the world. Long-term partnerships between Australia, the US, and the UK have strengthened cooperative relationships. Their collaboration leads to further understanding on global supply chains, geopolitical dynamics and localised defence requirements.  
The Global Executive MBA (Defence and Space) is delivered in partnership with the University of Exeter (UK) and Carnegie Mellon University (US). Our program provides invaluable networking opportunities with industry experts and peers. 
Study curriculum across three continents, informed by input from world-leading defence policy institutes and thinktanks. Get ready to join the global debate stage on defence and space topics.
Key features
Learn from internationally recognised academics and industry leaders in defence and space. Study a curriculum tailored to the defence and space industries. Take your studies abroad with in-country residentials in Australia, the UK and the US. Build your leadership skills by drawing on a unique global model. Gain a solid understanding of sector developments, challenges and solutions. Engage with a diverse global network of experienced professionals. Study online and attend immersive residential experiences in Adelaide, Washington DC and Exeter.
What you'll learn
Adelaide University’s Global Executive MBA (Defence and Space) will build on your expertise in strategic thinking, ethical conduct, responsible leadership and evidence-based decision making.
Our degree has a strong practical focus that is taught from a global perspective. Explore the latest in defence and space management research. Advance your skills in executive leadership and senior management decision-making.  
The program consists of a total of eleven core courses. Industry-specific topics include cybersecurity, space systems and complex defence project management. You’ll also study core business topics in leadership, strategy and finance. 
Delivered across three countries (Australia, the UK and the US), you’ll study an intensive two weeks in each location*. Online courses will also be delivered throughout your studies.
Our curriculum has a strong practical focus, specifically designed for those already employed in the defence and space sectors.  
Your capstone project will give you the opportunity to synthesis your knowledge in an applied setting. Engage in real-world experiences with international colleagues, contributing to your personal and professional development. 
Undertake case studies in key areas like strategy, global leadership, procurement and geopolitics in defence and space settings. Apply your learning to relevant industry settings and graduate ready to take what you’ve learned into your career.
*Please note, you’ll need to obtain any required travel visas for Australia, the UK and the US. Wait times can vary, so it’s important to get started early. For further information, visit Australian Department of Home Affairs, U.S. Department of Home Affairs and Gov.UK.

Entry requirements




Admission criteria
This program is not available to international students wishing to study in Australia on a student visa.
Applications for this program will open in August 2025, to commence study in 2026.
To be eligible, an applicant must have achieved the following minimum entry requirements and demonstrate they fulfil any prerequisite and essential criteria for admission. In cases where there are more eligible applicants than available places, admission will be competitive with ranks based on the entry criteria.
A completed bachelor (AQF level 7) or bachelor honours (AQF level 8) degree or equivalent from a recognised higher education institution PLUS a minimum of three years full time (or equivalent) management experience.Applicants who do not have an undergraduate qualification may be considered for entry into the Graduate Certificate program if they have a minimum of 7 years full-time (or equivalent) management experience.
This degree requires a Grade Point Average (GPA) equivalent to an Adelaide University 5.0 on a 7-point scale for entry.
 Applicants are asked to provide:
A Curriculum Vitae outlining their work and management experience; ANDA statement outlining their reasons for applying for the Global Executive MBA (Defence and Space) program and how it fits with their career goals within the defence and space sectors.
Shortlisted applicants will be required to participate in online interviews.
 Essential requirements:
Applicants must be citizens of any of the "Five Eyes" (Australia, Canada, New Zealand, United Kingdom, United States) or allied nations.Where previous study/work experience was conducted in English, the application must be accompanied by certified documentation from the educational institution/employer certifying that the language of instruction/employment was English.
English language entry requirements
In addition, international students who speak English as an additional language must have obtained one of the following standards within the last two years prior to admission. Possession of one or more of these qualifications, in addition to the academic entry requirements, does not, in itself, guarantee a place at Adelaide University. Applications are considered on an individual basis and selection is competitive. Where previous study/work experience was conducted in English, the application must be accompanied by certified documentation from the educational institution/employer certifying that the language of instruction/employment was English.

Why  Global Executive Master of Business Administration (Defence and Space)?
Study a world-class MBA qualification.  
Secure national defence partnerships. Develop strategies for space exploration. Deepen our bi- and multilateral global relationships through advocacy and sustainability.  
Change the face of defence and space industries, harnessing rapid technological advancements. Develop the skills and knowledge to meet the needs of these growing sectors. 
Embark on a transformative journey across three of the world’s leading nations in defence and space.  













Overview
Immerse yourself in a global experience that spans three powerhouse nations. Learn from renowned international speakers and real-world case studies. You’ll join a cohort of peers from “Five Eyes” and allied nations, preparing for global leadership opportunities. 
The defence and space industries are growing rapidly. Countless projects are being undertaken in Australia and around the world. Long-term partnerships between Australia, the US, and the UK have strengthened cooperative relationships. Their collaboration leads to further understanding on global supply chains, geopolitical dynamics and localised defence requirements.  
The Global Executive MBA (Defence and Space) is delivered in partnership with the University of Exeter (UK) and Carnegie Mellon University (US). Our program provides invaluable networking opportunities with industry experts and peers. 
Study curriculum across three continents, informed by input from world-leading defence policy institutes and thinktanks. Get ready to join the global debate stage on defence and space topics. 




Key features
Learn from internationally recognised academics and industry leaders in defence and space. Study a curriculum tailored to the defence and space industries. Take your studies abroad with in-country residentials in Australia, the UK and the US. Build your leadership skills by drawing on a unique global model. Gain a solid understanding of sector developments, challenges and solutions. Engage with a diverse global network of experienced professionals. Study online and attend immersive residential experiences in Adelaide, Washington DC and Exeter. 







What you'll learn
Adelaide University’s Global Executive MBA (Defence and Space) will build on your expertise in strategic thinking, ethical conduct, responsible leadership and evidence-based decision making.
Our degree has a strong practical focus that is taught from a global perspective. Explore the latest in defence and space management research. Advance your skills in executive leadership and senior management decision-making.  
The program consists of a total of eleven core courses. Industry-specific topics include cybersecurity, space systems and complex defence project management. You’ll also study core business topics in leadership, strategy and finance. 
Delivered across three countries (Australia, the UK and the US), you’ll study an intensive two weeks in each location*. Online courses will also be delivered throughout your studies.
Our curriculum has a strong practical focus, specifically designed for those already employed in the defence and space sectors.  
Your capstone project will give you the opportunity to synthesis your knowledge in an applied setting. Engage in real-world experiences with international colleagues, contributing to your personal and professional development. 
Undertake case studies in key areas like strategy, global leadership, procurement and geopolitics in defence and space settings. Apply your learning to relevant industry settings and graduate ready to take what you’ve learned into your career.
*Please note, you’ll need to obtain any required travel visas for Australia, the UK and the US. Wait times can vary, so it’s important to get started early. For further information, visit Australian Department of Home Affairs, U.S. Department of Home Affairs and Gov.UK.

Design a study path that works for you
This degree is part of a stackable set of qualifications, meaning your study choices are flexible. If your goals shift, you can exit after six months of study with a standalone Graduate Certificate or after one year with a Graduate Diploma qualification. 
You can also begin your studies with a shorter qualification like the six-month Graduate Certificate and continue on to complete the Graduate Diploma (one year) or full master’s degree.

Career outcomes
Our MBA will future-proof your career in defence and space. You’ll graduate with the knowledge to set yourself apart in the competitive job market. Become a global entrepreneur and leader, confident to handle challenges in global defence and space contexts.  
You’ll also engage with a diverse global network of experienced industry professionals throughout your degree. Be poised to harness your connections and work collaboratively to shape the future of your industry.
Graduates of this program can excel as leaders in industry across senior management and leadership roles. Your comprehensive knowledge of defence and space sector developments might be applied to roles in cybersecurity, space systems, space operations, geopolitics, defence procurement and more. 
Industry trends 
Australia, the United Kingdom and the United States have recently reached a significant milestone in our AUKUS agreement. The UK and US will now cooperate with Australia in safely building, operating and maintaining a conventionally-armed, nuclear-powered submarine capability. Future SSN-AUKUS submarines will be built at Osborne in South Australia (Australian Government Defence, 2024).  
According to the Australian Institute of International Affairs (2024), ‘Australia’s space industry has A$2 billion in planned capital investments [with a commitment] to invest A$7 billion over the next decade in the Defence Department’s space capabilities.'
Graduate from your Adelaide University degree with the global leadership skills needed to contribute to these expanding industries.

Career outcomes
Our MBA will future-proof your career in defence and space. You’ll graduate with the knowledge to set yourself apart in the competitive job market. Become a global entrepreneur and leader, confident to handle challenges in global defence and space contexts.  
You’ll also engage with a diverse global network of experienced industry professionals throughout your degree. Be poised to harness your connections and work collaboratively to shape the future of your industry.
Graduates of this program can excel as leaders in industry across senior management and leadership roles. Your comprehensive knowledge of defence and space sector developments might be applied to roles in cybersecurity, space systems, space operations, geopolitics, defence procurement and more. 
Industry trends 
Australia, the United Kingdom and the United States have recently reached a significant milestone in our AUKUS agreement. The UK and US will now cooperate with Australia in safely building, operating and maintaining a conventionally-armed, nuclear-powered submarine capability. Future SSN-AUKUS submarines will be built at Osborne in South Australia (Australian Government Defence, 2024).  
According to the Australian Institute of International Affairs (2024), ‘Australia’s space industry has A$2 billion in planned capital investments [with a commitment] to invest A$7 billion over the next decade in the Defence Department’s space capabilities.'
Graduate from your Adelaide University degree with the global leadership skills needed to contribute to these expanding industries.

Admission criteria
This program is not available to international students wishing to study in Australia on a student visa.
Applications for this program will open in August 2025, to commence study in 2026.
To be eligible, an applicant must have achieved the following minimum entry requirements and demonstrate they fulfil any prerequisite and essential criteria for admission. In cases where there are more eligible applicants than available places, admission will be competitive with ranks based on the entry criteria.
A completed bachelor (AQF level 7) or bachelor honours (AQF level 8) degree or equivalent from a recognised higher education institution PLUS a minimum of three years full time (or equivalent) management experience.Applicants who do not have an undergraduate qualification may be considered for entry into the Graduate Certificate program if they have a minimum of 7 years full-time (or equivalent) management experience.
This degree requires a Grade Point Average (GPA) equivalent to an Adelaide University 5.0 on a 7-point scale for entry.
 Applicants are asked to provide:
A Curriculum Vitae outlining their work and management experience; ANDA statement outlining their reasons for applying for the Global Executive MBA (Defence and Space) program and how it fits with their career goals within the defence and space sectors.
Shortlisted applicants will be required to participate in online interviews.
 Essential requirements:
Applicants must be citizens of any of the "Five Eyes" (Australia, Canada, New Zealand, United Kingdom, United States) or allied nations.Where previous study/work experience was conducted in English, the application must be accompanied by certified documentation from the educational institution/employer certifying that the language of instruction/employment was English.
English language entry requirements
In addition, international students who speak English as an additional language must have obtained one of the following standards within the last two years prior to admission. Possession of one or more of these qualifications, in addition to the academic entry requirements, does not, in itself, guarantee a place at Adelaide University. Applications are considered on an individual basis and selection is competitive. Where previous study/work experience was conducted in English, the application must be accompanied by certified documentation from the educational institution/employer certifying that the language of instruction/employment was English.

Why  Global Executive Master of Business Administration (Defence and Space)?
Study a world-class MBA qualification.  
Secure national defence partnerships. Develop strategies for space exploration. Deepen our bi- and multilateral global relationships through advocacy and sustainability.  
Change the face of defence and space industries, harnessing rapid technological advancements. Develop the skills and knowledge to meet the needs of these growing sectors. 
Embark on a transformative journey across three of the world’s leading nations in defence and space.  













Overview
Immerse yourself in a global experience that spans three powerhouse nations. Learn from renowned international speakers and real-world case studies. You’ll join a cohort of peers from “Five Eyes” and allied nations, preparing for global leadership opportunities. 
The defence and space industries are growing rapidly. Countless projects are being undertaken in Australia and around the world. Long-term partnerships between Australia, the US, and the UK have strengthened cooperative relationships. Their collaboration leads to further understanding on global supply chains, geopolitical dynamics and localised defence requirements.  
The Global Executive MBA (Defence and Space) is delivered in partnership with the University of Exeter (UK) and Carnegie Mellon University (US). Our program provides invaluable networking opportunities with industry experts and peers. 
Study curriculum across three continents, informed by input from world-leading defence policy institutes and thinktanks. Get ready to join the global debate stage on defence and space topics.
Key features
Learn from internationally recognised academics and industry leaders in defence and space. Study a curriculum tailored to the defence and space industries. Take your studies abroad with in-country residentials in Australia, the UK and the US. Build your leadership skills by drawing on a unique global model. Gain a solid understanding of sector developments, challenges and solutions. Engage with a diverse global network of experienced professionals. Study online and attend immersive residential experiences in Adelaide, Washington DC and Exeter.
What you'll learn
Adelaide University’s Global Executive MBA (Defence and Space) will build on your expertise in strategic thinking, ethical conduct, responsible leadership and evidence-based decision making.
Our degree has a strong practical focus that is taught from a global perspective. Explore the latest in defence and space management research. Advance your skills in executive leadership and senior management decision-making.  
The program consists of a total of eleven core courses. Industry-specific topics include cybersecurity, space systems and complex defence project management. You’ll also study core business topics in leadership, strategy and finance. 
Delivered across three countries (Australia, the UK and the US), you’ll study an intensive two weeks in each location*. Online courses will also be delivered throughout your studies.
Our curriculum has a strong practical focus, specifically designed for those already employed in the defence and space sectors.  
Your capstone project will give you the opportunity to synthesis your knowledge in an applied setting. Engage in real-world experiences with international colleagues, contributing to your personal and professional development. 
Undertake case studies in key areas like strategy, global leadership, procurement and geopolitics in defence and space settings. Apply your learning to relevant industry settings and graduate ready to take what you’ve learned into your career.
*Please note, you’ll need to obtain any required travel visas for Australia, the UK and the US. Wait times can vary, so it’s important to get started early. For further information, visit Australian Department of Home Affairs, U.S. Department of Home Affairs and Gov.UK.

Design a study path that works for you
This degree is part of a stackable set of qualifications, meaning your study choices are flexible. If your goals shift, you can exit after six months of study with a standalone Graduate Certificate or after one year with a Graduate Diploma qualification. 
You can also begin your studies with a shorter qualification like the six-month Graduate Certificate and continue on to complete the Graduate Diploma (one year) or full master’s degree.

Admission criteria
This program is not available to international students wishing to study in Australia on a student visa.
Applications for this program will open in August 2025, to commence study in 2026.
To be eligible, an applicant must have achieved the following minimum entry requirements and demonstrate they fulfil any prerequisite and essential criteria for admission. In cases where there are more eligible applicants than available places, admission will be competitive with ranks based on the entry criteria.
A completed bachelor (AQF level 7) or bachelor honours (AQF level 8) degree or equivalent from a recognised higher education institution PLUS a minimum of three years full time (or equivalent) management experience.Applicants who do not have an undergraduate qualification may be considered for entry into the Graduate Certificate program if they have a minimum of 7 years full-time (or equivalent) management experience.
This degree requires a Grade Point Average (GPA) equivalent to an Adelaide University 5.0 on a 7-point scale for entry.
 Applicants are asked to provide:
A Curriculum Vitae outlining their work and management experience; ANDA statement outlining their reasons for applying for the Global Executive MBA (Defence and Space) program and how it fits with their career goals within the defence and space sectors.
Shortlisted applicants will be required to participate in online interviews.
 Essential requirements:
Applicants must be citizens of any of the "Five Eyes" (Australia, Canada, New Zealand, United Kingdom, United States) or allied nations.Where previous study/work experience was conducted in English, the application must be accompanied by certified documentation from the educational institution/employer certifying that the language of instruction/employment was English.
English language entry requirements
In addition, international students who speak English as an additional language must have obtained one of the following standards within the last two years prior to admission. Possession of one or more of these qualifications, in addition to the academic entry requirements, does not, in itself, guarantee a place at Adelaide University. Applications are considered on an individual basis and selection is competitive. Where previous study/work experience was conducted in English, the application must be accompanied by certified documentation from the educational institution/employer certifying that the language of instruction/employment was English.

IELTS Overall 7.5
IELTS Reading 7
IELTS Listening 7
IELTS Speaking 7
IELTS Writing 7
